intro: Asystasia calycina, commonly known as the pink-flowered asystasia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine pubescence. Asystasia calycina thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
